00026 /*
00027   This header defines macros which enable compile-time program
00028   instrumentation. These macros work for both C and C++. Enclose the entire
00029   statement to be debugged within the DBG() macro *and* put the semicolon
00030   after the macro. (e.g., DBG(cerr << "Bad program" << endl); ). Statements
00031   should not span lines unless they include `\'s to escape the newlines.
00032 
00033   jhrg 10/13/94
00034 */
00035   
00036 #ifndef _debug_h
00037 #define _debug_h
00038 
00039 #ifdef __cplusplus
00040 
00041 #include <iostream>
00042 using std::cerr;
00043 using std::string;
00044 using std::endl;
00045 #define FILE_N_LINE cerr << __FILE__ << ": " << __LINE__ << ":"
00046 
00047 #else
00048 
00049 #define FILE_N_LINE fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d: ", __FILE__, __LINE__);
00050 
00051 #endif /* cplusplus */
00052 
00053 #ifdef DODS_DEBUG
00054 #define DBG(x) FILE_N_LINE; x
00055 #define DBGN(x) x
00056 #else
00057 #define DBG(x) /* x */
00058 #define DBGN(x) /* x */
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 #ifdef DODS_DEBUG2
00062 #define DBG2(x) FILE_N_LINE; x
00063 #else
00064 #define DBG2(x) /* x */
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 #ifdef DODS_PERF
00068 #error "Deprecated macro!"
00069 #endif
00070

00125 #endif /* _debug_h */
